PlantForm: Erect annual or biennial rosette herb.
Stem: Stout, hollow or filled with pith, ribbed, sometimes cottony.
Leaves: Shiny green with white veins and blotches (variegations) above, underneath hairy and paler, spiny on margins and over veins. Larger in rosette and more deeply lobed on stem.
Flowers: Large 3-5 cm, spiny, and at the end of long stalks, consist of numerous pink-purple tubular florets forming a head.
FruitSeeds: Seeds are 5-8 mm long, flattened and shiny blackish with longer barbed bristles.
DistinguishingFeatures: Unlikely to be confused due to variegated leaves and general shape.
